displaytitle: Seated Madonna nursing the Child, from an inlaid floor panel in the Siena Duomo
medium: Pen and brown ink with brush and brown wash
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
markings: Watermark: crown under six-pointed star (similar to Briquet 4835)

titles.title: Seated Madonna nursing the Child, from an inlaid floor panel in the Siena Duomo

makers.displaydate: 1484–1551; born Cortine in Valdibiana Montaperti, Italy; died Siena, Italy

displaymaker: after Domenico Beccafumi, 1484–1551; born Cortine in Valdibiana Montaperti, Italy; died Siena, Italy | formerly attributed to Tiburzio Passarotti, Italian, ca. 1555–1612 | formerly attributed to Bugiardini
caption: After Domenico Beccafumi (1484–1551; born Cortine in Valdibiana Montaperti, Italy; died Siena, Italy), formerly attributed to Tiburzio Passarotti (Italian, ca. 1555–1612), formerly attributed to Bugiardini, Seated Madonna nursing the Child, from an inlaid floor panel in the Siena Duomo. Pen and brown ink with brush and brown wash; 37.5 x 25.6 cm. Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895 (x1948-552)
captionhtml: After Domenico Beccafumi (1484–1551; born Cortine in Valdibiana Montaperti, Italy; died Siena, Italy), formerly attributed to Tiburzio Passarotti (Italian, ca. 1555–1612), formerly attributed to Bugiardini, Seated Madonna nursing the Child, from an inlaid floor panel in the Siena Duomo. Pen and brown ink with brush and brown wash; 37.5 x 25.6 cm. Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895 (x1948-552)
